info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Saratoga, southern Washington and west central Bennington Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 257 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greenwich, or 10 miles east of Saratoga Springs, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Shaftsbury, Cambridge, Greenwich, Gates, Northumberland, White Creek, Schuylerville, Sunderland, Victory, Glastenbury, Deans Corners, Chiselville, Center Falls, Grangerville, South Shaftsbury, Middle Falls, Eagleville, North Cambridge and Hidden Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
